questions.prompt: David and Goliath: Underdogs, Misfits, and the Art of Battling Giants is the fifth New York Times best seller from what Canadian journalist and The New Yorker staff writer?

Until King Louis XIV moved his main residence to the Palace of Versailles in 1682, this Parisian landmark was the monarch's official residence, having been enlarged over the years, integrated with the adjacent Tuileries Palace, and enhanced with an elaborately planned garden.
In geometry, two angles that add up to 90 degrees are said to be complementary. What is the term for angles that add up to 180 degrees?

On two occasions in the late 13th century, attacks on Japan by Kublai Khan's armies were thwarted with the help of typhoons which the Japanese regarded as "divine winds." What was the Japanese term used for these typhoons? This term became common many years later in a different context.

Give the name for the branch of metaphysics that studies being, the nature of reality, and the establishment of what is. It is a compound term derived from the Greek words for "being" and "science" or "knowledge".

Fill in the blank in this excerpt from section 8.05 of the Major League Baseball Official Rules (2014 Edition): If there is a runner, or runners, it is a _________ when -- (a) The pitcher, while touching his plate, makes any motion naturally associated with his pitch and fails to make such delivery;
